basics.name: Leah Lee
basics.label: Mechanical Engineering Student
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineering undergraduate at UIUC focused on vehicle systems, mechanical design, controls, and robotics hardware.

work.name: Novel Mobile Robots Lab, University of Illinois
highlights: Design and build self-actuated surface inspection robot using vision-based tactile sensing
Build test rig and system model to size actuators and validate control performance
Create CAD models and rapid prototypes to achieve stable contact and manufacturable geometry
Develop closed-loop contact module using force/pressure feedback for tracking on flat, curved, and inverted surfaces

work.name: RoboTouch Lab, University of Illinois
highlights: Develop new vision-based tactile sensor for large-area robotic surface scanning
Fabricate hardware using ESP32S3 and custom PCB, with multi-part molds for repeatable casting
Build image processing pipeline in Python using OpenCV and photometric stereo to reconstruct surface depth
Conference paper submitted to IROS

work.name: Somansa
highlights: Built RAG system for ZTNA documentation using LLMs, embedding models, and chunked retrieval
Evaluated model performance using prompt-based tests and recorded accuracy comparisons
Developed Python scripts to crawl technical websites and convert PDF/HTML documents into training data

work.name: Foellinger Auditorium
highlights: Operate audio-visual systems and manage venue layout for lectures, exams, and performances with 1,300+ attendees

projects.name: Illini Solar Car
highlights: Lead design and fabrication of fairing door molds using 3D-printed tooling and carbon fiber/fiberglass composite layup
Manufacture and assemble composite components using sanding, trimming, surface finishing, and vacuum bagging
Coordinate with aero, structures, and melec teams to ensure proper fit and integration

projects.name: ArachnoBot â€” ASME 1st Place, Distinguished Robotics
highlights: Designed and built terrain-adaptive robot for Engineering Open House
Implemented 4-bar linkage mechanism to achieve stable movement across varied surfaces
Presented to 1,000+ visitors

projects.name: Assistive Technology Development Project
highlights: Designed assistive devices under one-handed accessibility constraints
Optimized for single-print, lightweight, simple assembly

volunteer.organization: Engineering Council, Undergraduate Research in Scientific Advancement
highlights: Lead weekly committee meetings and manage logistics
Coordinate with faculty and graduate mentors to support participant progress
